Articles.Content: Hello I play a ksp and I have a problem when I make for example a trajectory that starts from kerbin to go to a duna when I change from the orbit of kerbin to that around the sun it changes the appoapsis around duna without I put any push and rcs it always changes  the altidude of my orbits no matter the celestial body every time I change from one orbit to another is this normal? how then I settled get problem (I play on ksp steam 1.7.3.2594)thank you!

There are some rounding errors when you change from one SOI to another SOI. These can easily change your orbit at the other end of an interplanetary transfer.

I believe the errors are minimized when you don't have the transiting vessel in focus (or within physics range in general).
Slowing down before you exit an SOI also helps. If you download the “Time Control” mod you tell it to warp to “SOI” which will help a lot.
